availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Brant Winans (Warren County, Kentucky, carriage maker)

body.p: Warren County, Kentucky, carriage maker. New Jersey native. Married to Anna Strange Winans in Warren County, Kentucky, on October 15, 1857. Father of Mary Winans and Bill Winans. Carriage maker in Warren County in 1860. Owned five enslaved persons in Warren County in 1860. Carriage maker in Warren County in 1864.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, District 1, p. 856.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, District 1, p. 440A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, Bowling Green, p. 41A.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Warren County, KY, February 1864, p. 367.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File 116.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Warren County Marriages, Film 000164008.
"William Brant Winans (1831-1907)," Find A Grave, Memorial 119392619, accessed November 3, 2023, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/119392619.
